datafield.subfield: Schools, Colleges, Institutes and Libraries Personnel Service Center.
Schools, Colleges, Institutes and Libraries Personnel Service Center (University of Michigan) records,

The SCIL Personnel Service Center served as a Liaison between the University Personnel office's functions and operating units Personnel served, and between the units served by the center and potential faculty and staff.
It developed and administered policies and programs to attract, select, develop, and retain a diverse faculty and staff.

Records include Monthly Reports from July 1984 to June 1988 which describe major accomplishments and problems in the areas of compensation, staff relations, employment and staff development. They briefly describe specific examples of problems relating to sexual harrassment, RIF, discipline of employees, and organizational restructuring.

The collection also contains Advisory Group materials from January 1987 to November 1990. The Advisory Group was a body which developed and reviewed personnel policies for the academic units in SCIL. In addition to minutes from the group meetings, there are statistical overviews of personnel matters and background materials used in policy development.
